TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ResXFileRef extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a link to an external resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ResXFileRef class is used to include references to files in an XML resource (.resx) file. A ResXFileRef object represents a link to an external resource in an XML resource (.resx) file. You add the ResXFileRef object to a .resx file by calling the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.AddResource%28System.Resources.ResXDataNode%29?displayProperty=fullName> method.
In a data entry in a .resx file, the type is ResXFileRef, and the value is the path location on disk. When the resource manager deserializes the object, the ResXFileRef performs the I/O to get the file. The following is an example of a .resx file.
``` <data name="iconclip" type="System.Resources.ResXFileRef, System.Windows.Forms"> <value>lookout.bmp;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing</value> </data> <data name="mailbackground" type="System.Resources.ResXFileRef, System.Windows.Forms"> <value>mailbackground.bmp;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing</value> </data> <data name="xplogo" type="System.Resources.ResXFileRef, System.Windows.Forms"> <value>xplogo.png;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing</value> </data> ```
To add a ResXFileRef object to a .resx file programmatically, you call the <xref:System.Resources.ResXDataNode.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Resources.ResXFileRef%29?displayProperty=fullName> constructor to instantiate a <xref:System.Resources.ResXDataNode> object. You then pass this <xref:System.Resources.ResXDataNode> object to the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.AddResource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
When you compile a .resx file with [Resgen.exe (Resource File Generator)](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), the resources specified in the .resx file are embedded in the resulting document resource file.

Docs.permission: for full trust for inheritors. This class cannot be inherited by partially trusted code.
for full trust for the immediate caller. This class cannot be used by partially trusted code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string fileName, string typeName) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of the resource that is referenced.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class that references the specified file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The type referred to by the `typeName` parameter must support a public constructor that accepts a <xref:System.IO.Stream> object as a parameter.

Docs.permission: for full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.

Docs.param: The type name of the resource that is referenced.
The encoding used in the referenced file.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that references the specified file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The type referred to by the `typeName` parameter must support a public constructor that accepts a <xref:System.IO.Stream> object as a parameter.

Docs.permission: for full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
